studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: ALXN1840 Treatment
arms.description: All participants receive ALXN1840, starting at 15 mg/day for approximately 28 days, then titrating up to 30 mg/day from Day 29.

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 1 (treatment experienced)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for > 28 days

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 2 (treatment naïve)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for ≤ 28 days

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population for the study as defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary Objective
objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 1
objectives.text: Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 2
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 3
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 4
objectives.text: Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 5
objectives.text: Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 6
objectives.text: Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 1
objectives.text: Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 2
objectives.text: Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 3
objectives.text: Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.name: Primary Endpoint
endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 4
endpoints.text: Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 5
endpoints.text: Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 6
endpoints.text: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum

endpoints.name: Safety Endpoint
endpoints.text:
Safety parameters: 
• Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs) 
• Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis) 
• Physical examinations 
• Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG 
• Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: ALXN1840 (bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate; formerly known as WTX101) is a novel copper binding agent in development for the treatment of Wilson disease (WD).

studyInterventions.name: Paracetamol/acetaminophen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted for use as an exception with the approval of the Investigator at doses of a maximum 1000 mg per day.

studyInterventions.name: Ibuprofen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted for use with caution and approval of the Investigator. The dose must not exceed 1200 mg in any 24-hour period.

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

studyAmendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis.

procedures.name: Blood Sampling
procedures.label: Blood Draw
procedures.description: Collection of blood samples for pharmacokinetic (PK), pharmacodynamic (PD), serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, pregnancy tests, and viral screening (HIV, Hepatitis B and C).

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Urine Collection
procedures.label: Urine Sample Collection
procedures.description: Collection of urine for urinalysis, drug screening, pregnancy testing, and 24-hour collection for copper and molybdenum measurement.

procedures.name: Fecal Collection
procedures.label: Stool Sample Collection
procedures.description: Collection of fecal samples for measurement of copper and molybdenum content.

procedures.name: Electrocardiogram
procedures.label: ECG
procedures.description: Triplicate 12-lead ECG to assess heart rate and intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc).

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report

procedures.name: Vital Signs Measurement
procedures.label: Vital Signs
procedures.description: Assessment of body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

procedures.name: Physical Examination
procedures.label: Physical Exam
procedures.description: A full physical examination including assessments of the cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, and neurological systems. Symptom-driven physical examinations may also be performed.

procedures.name: Oral Drug Administration
procedures.label: ALXN1840 Administration
procedures.description: Administration of ALXN1840 tablets, to be swallowed intact with 240 mL of water after an overnight fast.

procedures.name: Clinical Safety Laboratory Assessments
procedures.label: Safety Labs
procedures.description: Laboratory assessments including serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis.

procedures.name: Adverse Event Monitoring
procedures.label: AE Monitoring
procedures.description: Collection and follow-up of adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs).

procedures.name: Urine Drug Screen
procedures.label: Urine Drug Screen
procedures.description: Screening for drug use via urine sample.

procedures.name: Food and Fluid Sample Collection
procedures.label: Dietary Sample Collection
procedures.description: Collection of samples from all meal and fluid batches for measurement of copper and molybdenum content.

procedures.name: Height, Weight, and BMI Measurement
procedures.label: Anthropometric Measurements
procedures.description: Measurement of participant's height, weight, and calculation of Body Mass Index (BMI).

procedures.name: Neurological Monitoring
procedures.label: Neurological Monitoring
procedures.description: Regular monitoring for neurologic adverse events and neurological dysfunction.

procedures.name: Informed Consent
procedures.label: Informed Consent
procedures.description: Process of obtaining informed consent from the participant before any study-related procedures.

medicalDevices.name: Cannula
medicalDevices.label: Venous Cannula
medicalDevices.description: A cannula may be placed to minimize needle sticks for repeated blood draws.

medicalDevices.name: Catheter
medicalDevices.label: Venous Catheter
medicalDevices.description: A catheter for venous access, not to be left in place for longer than 72 hours.

medicalDevices.name: 12-lead ECG Machine
medicalDevices.label: ECG Machine
medicalDevices.description: Device used to perform triplicate 12-lead electrocardiograms.

medicalDevices.name: Automated Blood Pressure Device
medicalDevices.label: Automated BP Monitor
medicalDevices.description: A completely automated device for assessing blood pressure and heart rate measurements.

medicalDevices.name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer
medicalDevices.label: ICP-MS
medicalDevices.description: Used to determine the copper and molybdenum concentration of intake (food, fluids) and output (urine, feces) samples.

conditions.name: Moderate Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for moderate liver enzyme elevation requiring dose interruption.

conditions.name: Severe Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for severe liver enzyme elevation requiring discontinuation.

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury (Hy's Law)
conditions.description: Criteria for potential drug-induced liver injury requiring dose interruption.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3x ULN

conditions.name: Anemia
conditions.description: Criteria for anemia requiring dose reduction.

conditions.name: Thrombocytopenia
conditions.description: Criteria for low platelets requiring dose reduction.

conditions.name: Neutropenia
conditions.description: Criteria for low neutrophils requiring dose reduction.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for neurologic worsening requiring evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for psychiatric worsening requiring evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening

conditions.name: SRC Safety Review for Titration
conditions.description: Condition for dose escalation to 30 mg/day.
conditions.text: The Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before titration to 30 mg/day.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: Adaptive design feature allowing for extension of the outpatient period.
conditions.text: The Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: On Day 29, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 30 mg/day, following a 28-day period at 15 mg/day, pending SRC safety review.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate Transaminase Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 3x and <= 5x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Transaminase Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 5x ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Anemia or Thrombocytopenia
transitionRules.text: If Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL or Platelets < 100,000/mm3, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN and ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic or Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on neurologic or psychiatric worsening.

transitionRules.name: Remain on 15mg Dose due to Safety
transitionRules.text: Participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study if there are safety concerns that prevent up-titration.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (EOS Visit).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretion Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant may be withdrawn at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Serious Hypersensitivity Reaction
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a serious hypersensitivity reaction.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Severe Uncontrolled Infection
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a severe uncontrolled infection.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Use of Disallowed Medication
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for use of a disallowed medication.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered lost to follow-up if they repeatedly fail to return for scheduled visits and are unable to be contacted by the study site.

commentAnnotations.text: This amendment is considered to be substantial based on the criteria set forth in Article 10(a) of Directive 2001/20/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union, the US Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) regulation at 21 CFR part 312.30(b), and any applicable local regulations.

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Current protocol version. Clarifies study procedures in the US to facilitate recruitment and lessen participant inconvenience.

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Addition of a footnote to the Schedule of Activities to reference US-specific screening procedures.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: A number of days was changed to align text with other sections of the protocol.
Addition of procedures allowing US sites to perform screening-only activities to facilitate recruitment.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
To align the number of days with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol.

studyChanges.summary: Addition of text to the footnote of Table 1 to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.

studyChanges.beforeText: ...the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: ...the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: The number of days for the expected minimal inhibitory effect of zinc was changed from 30 to 21.
Addition of text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures.
